title: Alexis Alexandris
text:
Alexis Alexandris (<a href="Greek%20language">Greek</a>: Αλέξης Αλεξανδρής, sometimes wrongly called "Alekos Alexandris" born 21 October 1968) is a Greek former professional <a href="soccer">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a>.
Club career.
Alexis Alexandris began his career where he was born and raised, in Pelopas Kiato and in 1986 played for <a href="Veria%20F.C.">Veria</a>. After Veroia he moved to <a href="AEK%20Athens">AEK Athens</a> in 1991 where he won 3 consecutive championships. In 1994 Alexandris moved to <a href="Olympiacos%20F.C.">Olympiacos</a> where he had a very successful career winning 7 Greek championships and 1 Greek cup. At the sunset of his career he was also both player and <a href="coach%20%28sport%29">manager</a> for <a href="APOP%20Kinyras%20FC">APOP Kinyras</a> during the team's first participation in the <a href="Cypriot%20First%20Division">Cypriot First Division</a>.
International career.
Alexandris made 42 appearances and scored 10 goals for the <a href="Greece%20national%20football%20team">Greece national football team</a>, making his debut on 27 March 1991. He was a participant at the <a href="1994%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1994 FIFA World Cup</a> finals in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>.
Managerial career.
Alexis Alexandris starting his managing career on 12 February 2008 after taking over <a href="Kerkyra%20FC">Kerkyra FC</a> in <a href="Second%20Division%20%28Greece%29">Second Division (Greece)</a>. He left Kerkyra after a disagreement with the club's owner and from then moved to Olympiakos as the manager of the under21 squad.
Honours.
<a href="AEK%20Athens%20F.C.">AEK Athens</a>
<a href="Olympiacos%20F.C.">Olympiakos</a>
Individual
